title: Beyond Escape
opening: The newly crowned king of the Holy Kingdom of Faerghus, Dimitri, has declared fealty to the Church of Seiros and is raising an army in preparation for all-out war with the Empire. As the leader of the Alliance, Claude maintains a facade of neutrality amidst infighting between those who support and those who oppose the Empire. Meanwhile, the Black Eagle Strike Force plans to capture Alliance territory before Edelgard takes the war to the Kingdom and Church of Seiros. With sights set on capturing Derdriu at the center of House Riegan's territory, she leads a march across the Great Bridge of Myrddin to establish a bridgehead.
The Black Eagle Strike Force has an unexpected encounter with someone thought to have died years prior. Amidst the joy, your forces prepare to invade Alliance territory.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Five years ago to the day... If things had continued on as they were, today would have been the Millennium Festival.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Halt! Who's there?!

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: It can't be! Professor? Is it really you? But I searched everywhere and never found a trace! My teacher... what have you been doing all this time? Where have you been?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I was sleeping.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I was dead.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Joking?! At a time like this?! You do realize it's been five years since you disappeared!  Do you have any idea how guilty I felt? How broken my heart was? I searched high and low after you vanished! Although there was no proof, I somehow knew you were still alive. All this time, I led everyone as best I could, and fought with all my heart. It's been a difficult path to walk alone.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Welcome back, my teacher. I'm so happy that you're safe. Five years... Such a short time, but it fells like an eternity ago. Do you... still feel the way you did all those years ago? You said that you would fight at my side no matter how many enemies we should amass. As for me, my resolve has not faltered. I'm determined as ever to see this through to the end. I will defeat the false goddess. I will save this world from those creatures and give humanity its freedom back.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: So, my teacher, are you prepared to stand with me?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I am.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: I...I thank you. Truly. Now then, I assume you understand the situation at hand, yes?

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: I really was asleep all this time...

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Another joke. Or...are you telling the truth? I suppose you must be. In that case, I'll tell you all that has transpired as you slumbered these past five years.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: ...And that is where we are now. The war is at a stalemate. Dimitri is the new King of Faerghus. It's clear that his territory will continue to support the Church. Meanwhile, Claude's leadership has thrown the Alliance into chaos. He maintains neutrality in their internal conflict. The situation has created a deadlock. We've been awaiting an opportunity for our squadron to return to the monastery. With you in the fray, I believe the state of the war will shift immediately. The Church, as well as the Kingdom and the Alliance... The time has come to eliminate them all.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: The Kingdom and the Alliance...

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Although we were of different houses, we were companions who lived and learned together. Some of our ranks are hesitant to battle against them. However, knowing that you're alive is sure to raise their spirits.

dialogue.speaker: Byleth
dialogue.line: The Church of Seiros...

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Rhea, Seteth, the knights, and the others are in prime condition. They've set up their base within the Kingdom capital. The Immaculate One and her family have yet to fight on the front lines. However, we must eventually face and defeat them. It would mean a great deal to have you with us when the time comes.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Good. Well then, I believe it's time for a little reunion. The Black Eagle Strike Force never lost faith. They knew you were alive and have been awaiting your return. Let's not keep them waiting any longer.

dialogue.speaker: Hubert
dialogue.line: Well now. That face is certainly familiar. I am glad to see you alive and well, Professor.

dialogue.speaker: Bernadetta
dialogue.line: Professor, it's me, Bernie! Do you remember me? I can't believe you're here!

dialogue.speaker: Caspar
dialogue.line: I can't believe it! Is this a dream? Can we really be this lucky?!

dialogue.speaker: Petra
dialogue.line: This is not dreaming. Our professor is with us again!  Welcome to the back! I mean, welcome back!

dialogue.speaker: Ferdinand
dialogue.line: Our group isn't the same without you. I am overjoyed to see you again!

dialogue.speaker: Dorothea
dialogue.line: It's been so long. Seeing you again fills my heart with hope.

dialogue.speaker: Linhardt
dialogue.line: Great, now everything will be easy.  Um, that's great you're safe, Professor. I'm deeply, deeply moved.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Quite the reunion, isn't it, Professor? Everyone's happy to see you.

dialogue.speaker: Caspar
dialogue.line: Come on, Edelgard. You must be happier than all of us combined!

dialogue.speaker: Caspar
dialogue.line: She took it really hard when you disappeared, Professor.

dialogue.speaker: Ferdinand
dialogue.line: Of course, we did our very best in your absence. And there was never a day that we doubted you would return to us.

dialogue.speaker: Dorothea
dialogue.line: Edelgard has been leading us as emperor. But...after you disappeared, it became apparent that you were her anchor.

dialogue.speaker: Petra
dialogue.line: It gives me regret to be admitting this, but...our power is not enough. The only one who can be meeting Edelgard's expectations...is you, Professor.

dialogue.speaker: Linhardt
dialogue.line: Most impressive of all is your uncanny ability to bring a smile to everyone's face.

dialogue.speaker: Hubert
dialogue.line: In the years since you vanished, we have not lost anyone from our ranks.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: We all longed for your presence and your leadership. Myself included.

dialogue.speaker: Hubert
dialogue.line: It seems fitting to view this as a new beginning for the Black Eagle Strike Force. We already have our target.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: Yes. We must eliminate the Alliance before moving on to fight the Kingdom and the Church. However, that doesn't necessarily mean we must occupy the entirety of the Alliance. House Riegan stands against the Empire... Therefore, our target is Derdriu, the Aquatic Capital.

dialogue.speaker: Hubert
dialogue.line: We must cross the Airmid River, which separates the Empire and the Alliance. To do that, we must take the largest bridge across it. The Great Bridge of Myrddin. Myrddin connects the monastery and the Imperial capital to the east. It is the shortest route there.

dialogue.speaker: Edelgard
dialogue.line: An Alliance stronghold has been built at the Great Bridge. We'll take that and then head north. At the same time, we must defeat the one who defends it, Judith von Daphnel. If we can also take control of Daphnel territory, it would be greatly beneficial to us. Prepare yourselves. The next battle will be a momentous one. Join me, my friends, as we begin our journey to bring peace and solace to this war-ravaged world.

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: Professor... I'm sorry to have dragged you into the fight again so soon after our reunion. But you appeared at a most opportune time. I'm truly humbled by your support, my teacher. Thank you.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You can count on me.

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: And so I will. I'm hoping your ability from five years prior are still intact.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I hope I'm not rusty...

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: You may be worried, but you shouldn't be. You always manage to pull through.

conversation.speaker: Edelgard
conversation.line: Make sure you're ready to head out, OK?

conversation.speaker: Hubert
conversation.line: Allow me to brief you on the details of our situation. The Empire firmly controls the western portion of Faerghus. However, the central and eastern regions continue to put up heavy resistance. The strongholds in these regions are Arianrhod, the Fortress City, and Fhirdiad, the Kingdom Capital. We cannot control Faerghus until we have taken both of these cities. As for the Alliance, Houses Gloucester and Ordelia seem predisposed to to capitulate to us. However, due to interference from Houses Riegan and Goneril, we have yet to secure their cooperation. Claude obviously hopes to keep the Alliance whole through diplomacy. But because we have had to focus our efforts against the church until now, our forces have yet to meet his. We have only recently begun to take the fight to Alliance territory.

conversation.speaker: Ferdinand
conversation.line: The last five years have been difficult at times. My relationship with Edelgard is rather contentious, due to the incident with my father. Nevertheless, I cannot abandon my family's duties. As Duke Aegir, I must play my part in the Imperial army. Edelgard intends to abolish the nobility, but I know I can dissuade her from doing so.

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: Professor! Do you know how happy I was to hear you were still alive? I'll tell you how happy--for the past two days, I haven't had my morning or my afternoon naps.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Morning...nap?

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: Yes?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You were taking those naps every day?

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: Well, as long as we weren't marching. Can't sleep much then...but it's not for want of trying...

conversation.speaker: Linhardt
conversation.line: By the way, with Professor Hanneman not around... I've occupied his room. So I am well equipped to perform research on you. Isn't that exciting?

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: All right, I'm ready to fight! Let's do this!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Whoa, slow down.

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: You're right! I gotta keep it under control or I'm gonna wear myself out too quickly. Maybe I'll just get rid of a few monsters...or is that too risky right before a mission?

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm counting on you.

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: Leave it to me! I can take on the whole...most of the enemy's army!

conversation.speaker: Caspar
conversation.line: I know my limits now, Professor!

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Are we leaving for battle? I heard it's a long march. But it's fine! I've had plenty of time to stay inside lately, so I think it's time I...went out. Yeah! I can do this. No more Bernie-bear!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Bernie-bear?

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Oh yeah. People call me Bernie-bear since I hole up in my den all the time. Not anymore though!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: That's the spirit.

conversation.speaker: Bernadetta
conversation.line: Yes! But, um. Please don't put me up front, OK?

conversation.speaker: Dorothea
conversation.line: Laaa-la-laaa-la-laaa... Professor! Oh my! It's so good to see you. These days, so many old friends seem to be disappearing. But you... You're here! It's incredible to see you again after five years! I have a feeling your name will go down in history.

conversation.speaker: Petra
conversation.line: Edelgard is controlling the Empire. She is putting the pressure on the Kingdom and Alliance. Empire and religion are at open war. It will be...difficult for us at first. But corrupt nobles are many. That means the common people will rebel and be joining our side. With you, Professor, the battle tides will...ah, will turn. I have certainty.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: For five years, I've fought for the Empire. I've cut down hordes of enemies. Now I have the same look in my eyes that the boar used to have in his. The look of a savage beast who loves nothing but destruction and violence.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I don't see that look in your eyes.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: I hope not.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You're right.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: Hmph. I can hardly hold it against him anymore.

conversation.speaker: Felix
conversation.line: You and Edelgard must not disappoint me. Mark my words. The future you're building had better be worth all this bloodshed.

conversation.speaker: Ashe
conversation.line: Since you came back, everyone's been smiling. Just you being here makes an incredible difference. I can't express how reassuring it is to see you.

conversation.speaker: Sylvain
conversation.line: Hey, Professor. It's been a really long time, hasn't it? The last five years have been full of heartbreak-not from girls...but friends and family becoming enemies. One of the things that kept me going was the hope you'd return, and now here you are. A lot has changed, but you're back, and it's the first time I can remember being happy in a while.

conversation.speaker: Mercedes
conversation.line: I have good friends in both the Alliance and Faerghus, so this fighting weighs heavily on me... I can't bear the thought of battling the Knights of Seiros to the death! I have to keep my chin up though, right? Let's press on together, Professor.

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: My father used to be a knight in service of the royal family of Faerghus. For a time he was at the monastery, but apparently, he's back in Faerghus serving as a knight again. Which means if I fight with this family, I'll eventually have to face my own father...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: If you want to leave, now is the time.

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Don't say that! I know what I'm doing and I'm ready for anything.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Does that frighten you?

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Terribly. But...I've accepted my fate. I'm ready for anything.

conversation.speaker: Annette
conversation.line: Of course, if at all possible, I would prefer not to fight my father. This is the path I chose. I have no regrets.

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: His Highness, the new king, is in process of unifying the Kingdom under his command. His powerful army has joined forces with the Knights of Seiros, who moved their seat to Faerghus. And now they're presenting a unified front against the Imperial army. They're our greatest enemy, absolutely.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I wonder if we can win.

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: Presently, it's doubtful. That's why I'm in favor of first capturing Alliance lands.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Can you fight against your homeland?

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: I don't relish the idea, but there's no turning back now. For now, we should focus our efforts on the Alliance. The Kingdom and church can come afterwards.

conversation.speaker: Ingrid
conversation.line: Judith, who defends the Great Bridge of Myrddin, is a formidable opponent. We can't afford to drop our guard.

conversation.speaker: Lorenz
conversation.line: House Gloucester will remain staunchly neutral in this war. Even if we press into Alliance territory. My father is no threat to the Empire. Lady Edelgard surely understands that. The Great Bridge of Myrddin, however, is another story. I hear it is held by Judith of House Daphnel. She is renowned for her military prowess. We would do well not to underestimate her.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: Hey, Professor! What have you been up to for five years? Hope you haven't gone soft! I got myself into perfect shape. Took all five years of pushing my muscles to the limit, but look!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You look very strong.

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: You bet I do! You gotta get training if you want to catch up!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I don't really see a difference...

conversation.speaker: Raphael
conversation.line: What?! Can't you see my muscles? Do I gotta undress so you can get a better look?

conversation.speaker: Ignatz
conversation.line: I thought you might be at the monastery. That's why I made my way here. I decided to follow your path, because I believed in you. But then you vanished. Now that you've returned, I have my guiding light once again. Welcome back, Professor!

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: I'm relieved you're here, Professor. It seems we've reached a stalemate on the war front. I admit I'm feeling apprehensive about fighting the Alliance...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You have to cast aside your doubts.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: I agree. It's time to shelve my personal feelings and focus on the bigger picture.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: You don't have to do anything if you don't want to.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: No. I have to shelve my personal feelings. There are bigger things at play here.

conversation.speaker: Lysithea
conversation.line: I'll fight at full force. I'm counting on you to lead us to victory, Professor.

conversation.speaker: Marianne
conversation.line: My adoptive father sent me here so our family name would be known. He doesn't care which side wins, the Empire or the Alliance. However, even if he tells me to come home, I intend to stay. I want to see this new world Edelgard dreams of.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: I'm so glad to see you're all right. I really regretted not being able to keep the promise I made to my mentor.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Mentor?

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Captain Jeralt, obviously! I'm still his first and greatest apprentice, you know!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Promise?

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: Captain Jeralt told me that if anything should happen to him, then I should stick by you.

conversation.speaker: Leonie
conversation.line: I'm going to do just what he asked. I'll be right here to support you from now on.

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: Ah!

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Ah?

conversation.speaker: Alois
conversation.line: At long last, we meet again! I knew you were alive. I knew you could survive. And five years on, you arrive! We're reunited! I'm glad I kept watch for you in the downstream villages all that time. I was so devoted to finding you that I left the Knights of Seiros. Now I serve no one... Other than you! I'll protect you, just as I promised Captain Jeralt I would all those years ago.

conversation.speaker: Shamir
conversation.line: What's that look on your face? Surprised to see me? I'm a mercenary. Always have been. Even when I was with the Knights of Seiros. I never was too attached to Fódlan. I was considering leaving soon. But I might change my mind if you're around.

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: You've finally joined us, haven't you? I attached myself to the Imperial army as well. Seemed the thing to do. I feel I owe it to Edelgard to set my past feelings about the Empire aside. I am happy to help her. It's strange, isn't it? After five years, the three Professors are together once more. I am most curious though. You say you were asleep for five whole years? Incredible. Perhaps this is another effect of your Crest. I do look forward to investigating you in greater detail.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: We can talk about that.

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: Wonderful news! I am most excited to begin. We must find the time, of course.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Uh, maybe later...

conversation.speaker: Hanneman
conversation.line: I'll have to be content with observing you wherever you go, then. I cannot waste any opportunity!

conversation.speaker: Manuela
conversation.line: After the battle five years ago, the Imperial army occupied Garreg Mach. The cathedral and several other buildings were destroyed, but... We've done some repair work here and there, and we're using the buildings as a base of operations. As for me? Well, the church moved its headquarters to Faerghus, and I've seen no reason to follow. When I returned to Enbarr, I received a summons from Her Majesty, and I chose to answer.

conversation.speaker: Jeritza
conversation.line: You survived. How very fortunate... Were you dead, I wouldn't be able to fight you. But you are very much alive—now I've a chance to kill you.

conversation.speaker: Anna
conversation.line: There's unrest everywhere these days. All of my fellow merchants seem to be endangered. I hope things go back to normal soon. People need more to smile about, aside from my great deals.

conversation.speaker: Randolph
conversation.line: Ah, a new face. I am Randolph von Bergliez. I'm the guardian of this place. Wait a moment... I'm sure I've seen you somewhere before.

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: Five years ago...

conversation.speaker: Byleth
conversation.line: I'm a professor.

conversation.speaker: Randolph
conversation.line: Ah yes! You're Her Majesty's professor. You're alive?! Um... Oh, this is my little sister, Fleche. She's just a rookie, but she's helping me as my assistant.

conversation.speaker: Fleche
conversation.line: H-Hello. I'm Fleche von Bergliez. It's nice to meet you. I know I'm inexperienced, but I'm going to do my best. You can count on me to look after my big brother!

conversation.speaker: Randolph
conversation.line: I heard you're planning to march into Alliance territory. I'll be here to guard the fort.

conversation.speaker: Gatekeeper
conversation.line: Greetings, Professor! Nothing to report! What's that? Do I have brothers in the church? You really are well informed! My older twin works for the Knights of Seiros, but I think he's just a grunt. Not a noble gate keeper like yours truly. Unlike me, he's very devout. He left the Empire a long time ago.

intro.speaker: Hubert
intro.line: We are about to commence the attack on the Great Bridge of Myrddin. But first, allow me a moment of your time.

intro.speaker: Hubert
intro.line: It is something I can only ask of you. Listen well... It concerns Lady Edelgard's uncle. The regent of the Empire, Lord Arundel. Although he is currently cooperating with Her Majesty, he maintains his own sizable military troops. It seems to me that his plans differ from our own. I assume you recall a certain group's scheming from five years ago. Solon and Kronya... They both served Lord Arundel.

intro.speaker: Hubert
intro.line: Professor, I understand how you must be feeling, considering what they did to your father. I know it must be foul to even consider cooperating with their kind. However, their power is essential for us at present. Edelgard also strongly opposed the idea at first. Our enemy is the Church of Seiros itself. It cannot be toppled with the Empire's might alone. Those working under Lord Arundel are extremely hostile toward the church. And the enemy of our enemy is... Well, I think you sufficiently understand by now.

intro.speaker: Byleth
intro.line: Are you sure that's a good idea?

intro.speaker: Hubert
intro.line: Until all of Fódlan is united, it is a necessary evil. As for how we deal with them afterward...time will tell. Regardless, Her Majesty and I wish to join our power with yours.

intro.speaker: Hubert
intro.line: You should know that in her heart, Her Majesty regards that group as enemies of herself and her family. They used her father, the former emperor, as a puppet and murdered her siblings with their vile experimentation. I believe Her Majesty may have told you some of this herself. That is why this was a...very painful decision for her to make.

intro.speaker: Hubert
intro.line: I will do all I can to ensure her suffering is not in vain, and I hope I can count on you to do the same. As for all I have told you, please keep it in mind as we march forward. More importantly, I implore you to fight as best you can for Edelgard... From the bottom of my heart, I beg this of you.

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: We'll be capturing the Great Bridge of Myrddin, a key strategic location of the Leicester Alliance. Claude will surely be sending reinforcements, so we must prevail before they arrive.

battle.speaker: Hubert
battle.line: Our opponent is Judith, the so-called Hero of Daphnel. We can handle her. So long as we don't get careless.

battle.speaker: Judith
battle.line: The boy said to run if I was in danger, but... I could never do that. I'll hold out until reinforcements arrive!

battle.speaker: Leonie
battle.line: Judith! I'm so glad you're safe! Claude sent me here with reinforcements!

battle.speaker: Alliance General
battle.line: Sorry to keep you waiting, Judith! We're the reinforcements!

battle.speaker: Acheron
battle.line: Why do I have to put up with orders from that false leader...

battle.speaker: Leonie
battle.line: Because you're from the smallest noble house in all the Alliance, you whiner!

battle.speaker: Edelgard
battle.line: Enemy reinforcements... We didn't finish in time. Don't let them secure the ballista!

boss.speaker: Ignatz
boss.line: I am helping Claude build the future of Fódlan!

boss.speaker: Ignatz
boss.line: Ungh... I should have known this would happen...

boss.speaker: Judith
boss.line: Ignatz! Damn it... Such a good kid. He died too young...

boss.speaker: Leonie
boss.line: Judith, I'm sorry... I leave the rest to you...

boss.speaker: Judith
boss.line: Leonie! You had such a full life ahead of you... I wish I could take your place...

boss.speaker: Leonie
boss.line: Doesn't matter who you are. I won't hold back, and I won't fall to the Empire!

boss.speaker: Leonie
boss.line: You're all Captain Jeralt's enemies! And I will avenge him here!

boss.speaker: Judith
boss.line: This is it... Claude, I'm sorry. I couldn't defend the bridge. All who are able, retreat!

boss.speaker: Edelgard
boss.line: Don't let her escape! If we take her out now, the Daphnel territory will be ours! That will allow us to march safely through the Alliance.

boss.speaker: Judith
boss.line: Avoided death yet again, huh? I'll join Claude and prepare for a counter attack!

boss.speaker: Hubert
boss.line: Judith's escape will widen the battlefront. Our strategy's failed...

boss.speaker: Judith
boss.line: Guh, it looks like I'm done for. Claude... I'm sorry...

boss.speaker: Leonie
boss.line: Judith! No!

boss.speaker: Acheron
boss.line: The knights on the other side of this bridge are mine. I can't just let you cross!

boss.speaker: Acheron
boss.line: Guh... If only I had joined the Empire...sooner...

boss.speaker: Ignatz
boss.line: We can't place the future of Fódlan in Edelgard's hands. If you're allied with the Empire, I have no choice but to fight you.

boss.speaker: Raphael
boss.line: Outta my way, Ignatz! I don't wanna have to fight you!

boss.speaker: Ignatz
boss.line: Stop deluding yourself. You joined the Empire. Didn't you consider the consequences? I don't want to fight you either, Raphael! But this is war.

boss.speaker: Raphael
boss.line: Ignatz...

boss.speaker: Leonie
boss.line: Professor! You know Captain Jeralt's killer was connected to the Empire! Why did you side with them?! Answer me, traitor!

boss.speaker: Lorenz
boss.line: Acheron! What a pleasant surprise! I was concerned I might have to kill someone decent.

boss.speaker: Acheron
boss.line: Ha! House Gloucester is already finished. I've already taken control of your land!

boss.speaker: Lorenz
boss.line: That's quite enough of your spinning, Weathervane. Time for you to die.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: Alliance soldiers, Judith has fallen! Further conflict is futile! If you surrender, your lives will be spared. Lay down your weapons immediately.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: You have all fought well. With this victory, we now have a foothold in the Alliance. The Imperial Army will cross the Airmid River and push the front lines forward. The fight will continue, but do not allow that to stop you from taking pride in our hard-won victory.

end.speaker: Ferdinand
end.line: Ah, this should put a stop to one of Edelgard's choice phrases. Well done, Professor. I believe it was "if only the professor were here, we could forge ahead and change the tides of this war."

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: Ferdinand. It is not necessary to tell the professor such things.

end.speaker: Caspar
end.line: We're not the only ones benefiting! The whole Imperial Army is stronger now!

end.speaker: Linhardt
end.line: Yes, it seems the Empire finally has both of its legs to stand on. Don't you agree?

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: You make it sound as though I can't run the Empire on my own. Perhaps it's more apt to say that the pegasus has recovered its horn.

end.speaker: Dorothea
end.line: Judith of Daphnel... What a magnificent warrior. I'm happy to have the professor back just like old times, but I don't think I'll ever get used to this cruel exchange of lives...

end.speaker: Petra
end.line: When there is something you must not be conceding, you must keep fighting! The fighting has been continuing for five years, but now I am again witnessing the professor's power.

end.speaker: Bernadetta
end.line: I hate fighting! But...with the professor here...maybe it's slightly less terrible? Oh, but everyone is working so hard! Stop it, Bernie, you can't be the only one complaining!

end.speaker: Hubert
end.line: I'm glad to see everyone so inspired. It seems the reappearance of the professor has done much to raise your morale.

end.speaker: Edelgard
end.line: Do you not feel the same, Hubert? Come now, be honest with yourself. Now, we must take advantage of the situation and blaze ahead. Our path is still a long one.
